conclusion: ETC is the abbreviation for Electronic Toll Collection system.
The traffic speed at an ETC lane in Chongqing has increased from 20 km/h to 40 km/h.
A car travels at a constant velocity of v0 = 30 m/s towards the toll station along a straight line.
The car needs to decelerate uniformly to v1 = 5 m/s exactly d = 10 m before the center line of the toll station.
The car passes through the center line at constant velocity and finally accelerates uniformly back to v0 for normal driving.
The magnitude of the car's acceleration and deceleration is 1 m/s² in both processes.
Neglect the length of the car body.

premise: Initial velocity: v0 = 30 m/s, Final velocity after deceleration: v1 = 5 m/s, Magnitude of acceleration/deceleration: a = 1 m/s²
conclusion: The time taken for deceleration is t = 25 s.

premise: Initial velocity: v0 = 30 m/s, Time taken for deceleration: t = 25 s, Magnitude of acceleration/deceleration: a = 1 m/s²
conclusion: The displacement during deceleration is s1 = 437.5 m.
The car travels at v1 = 5 m/s from the position 10 m before the centerline, through the centerline.

premise: Final velocity after deceleration: v1 = 5 m/s, Initial velocity: v0 = 30 m/s, Magnitude of acceleration/deceleration: a = 1 m/s²
conclusion: The time taken for acceleration is t = 25 s.

premise: Final velocity after deceleration: v1 = 5 m/s, Time taken for acceleration: t = 25 s, Magnitude of acceleration/deceleration: a = 1 m/s²
conclusion: The displacement during acceleration is s3 = 437.5 m.

premise: Displacement during deceleration: s1 = 437.5 m, Distance before centerline: 10 m, Displacement during acceleration: s3 = 437.5 m
conclusion: The total displacement is s_total = 885 m.
